metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1664 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Dpkg::Source::Archive in dpkg, the Debian package management system, before version 1.21.8, 1.20.10, 1.19.8, 1.18.26 is prone to a directory traversal vulnerability. When extracting untrusted source packages in v2 and v3 source package formats that include a debian.tar, the in-place extraction can lead to directory traversal situations on specially crafted orig.tar and debian.tar tarballs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1664` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dpkg - 1.19.0.5ubuntu2.4
dselect - 1.19.0.5ubuntu2.4
libdpkg-perl - 1.19.0.5ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dpkg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.19.0.5ubuntu2.4').
